subject: Business
title: Sustainable Competitive Advantage
description: A short lesson to help you apply Sustainable Competitive Advantage.

hook.text: A company doubles profits. Competitors copy the strategy next quarter. The advantage lasted 90 days.

buildup.text: A sustainable advantage is one that competitors can't replicate quickly or cheaply.

discovery.text: Jay Barney's VRIN framework: valuable, rare, inimitable, and non-substitutable resources create lasting edges.

twist.text: In fast-moving industries, no advantage is truly permanent. The best strategy is a series of temporary ones.

climax.text: Netflix's advantage shifted from DVDs to streaming to original content. Each was temporary but well-timed.

punchline.text: Advantages expire. The skill is building the next one before they do.

quiz.question: What does the VRIN framework assess?
options: Whether a resource creates a sustainable competitive advantage
The financial health of a company
